content.title: National Handloom Development Programme: Concessional Credit/Weaver MUDRA Scheme
content.beneficiary: Handloom Weavers, Weaver Entrepreneurs, Self Help Groups, Handloom Organizations
content.details: The 'National Handloom Development Programme: Concessional Credit/Weaver MUDRA Scheme' is one of the components of the National Handloom Development Programme (NHDP) launched by the Ministry of Textiles, Government of India. The scheme aims to provide adequate and timely assistance from the banks to the handloom sector to meet their credit requirements for term loans & working capital in a flexible and cost-effective manner across the country.
eligibility: Handloom Weavers involved in weaving activity
Handloom organizations, including Primary Handloom Weavers’ Co-operative Societies
Producers’ Companies/Consortia promoted by handloom weavers
exclusions: Individual weavers who have already availed margin money assistance will not be eligible for financial assistance in terms of margin money assistance, interest subvention, and credit guarantee fee under the strength of Handloom Organization, SHGs, etc.
content.application_process: Offline. Eligible beneficiaries are required to approach the Participating Bank concerned along with required documents for availing of loan benefits under the scheme.
documents_required: Identity card issued by the O/o DC(Handlooms)
Identity card issued by the State Government
Handloom Organization– Registration Certificate, Balance Sheet, Profit & Loss Account, name of the weavers registered with the Organization

faqs.question: What is the ‘Concessional Credit/Weaver MUDRA Scheme’?
faqs.answer: The ‘Concessional Credit/Weaver MUDRA Scheme’ is a component of the National Handloom Development Programme (NHDP) launched by the Ministry of Textiles, Government of India to make available the credit to handloom weavers at concessional interest rates.

faqs.question: What is the aim of the Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to provide adequate and timely assistance from the banks to the handloom sector to meet their credit requirements for term loan & working capital in a flexible and cost effective manner across the country.

faqs.question: Which banks are eligible to participate in the ‘Concessional Credit/Weaver MUDRA Scheme’?
faqs.answer: All Scheduled Commercial Banks, Regional Rural Banks, State Cooperative Banks, District Central Co-operative Banks and any financial institution with the approval of Competent Authority of Ministry of Textiles, GoI.

faqs.question: What are the key benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Concessional Credit/Weaver MUDRA Scheme offers various benefits, including Margin Money Assistance, Interest Subvention, and Credit Guarantee.

faqs.question: What is the rate of Margin Money Assistance for Individual Handloom Weaver/Weaver Entrepreneur?
faqs.answer: Individual Handloom Weaver/Weaver Entrepreneur - Margin Money assistance @20% of loan amount, subject to maximum of ₹25,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the rate of Margin Money Assistance for Handloom organization?
faqs.answer: Handloom organization - Margin money assistance @20% of loan amount, subject to a maximum of ₹20.00 lakh (margin money @₹2.00 lakhs for every 100 weaver/worker).

faqs.question: What is the maximum Margin Money Assistance provided to Primary Handloom Weavers’ Co-operative Societies?
faqs.answer: Margin money assistance to Primary Handloom Weavers’ Co-operative Societies will be provided on the recommendation of State Director of Handlooms.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for Interest Subvention under the ‘Concessional Credit/Weaver MUDRA Scheme’?
faqs.answer: Subsidized loans at concessional interest rate of 6% for a period of three years will be available to eligible handloom organizations only.

faqs.question: How long is the Interest Subvention applicable after the first disbursal of the loan?
faqs.answer: Interest subvention as applicable will be provided maximum for 3 years from the date of first disbursal.

faqs.question: Which handloom organizations are eligible for Credit Guarantee under the ‘Concessional Credit/Weaver MUDRA Scheme’?
faqs.answer: The eligible handloom organizations will be guaranteed by the National Credit Guarantee Trustee Company (NCGTC)/Credit Guarantee Fund Trust for Micro & Small Enterprises (CGTMSE).

faqs.question: Where is the Margin Money Assistance transferred for Handloom Organizations?
faqs.answer: Margin money assistance will be transferred directly to loan account of Handloom Organization.

faqs.question: What is the method of fund transfer for Interest Subsidy and Credit Guarantee Fee under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The interest subsidy and credit guarantee fee will be transferred to the concerned bank.

faqs.question: Who are eligible to avail loans under the ‘Concessional Credit/Weaver MUDRA Scheme’?
faqs.answer: Following agencies are eligible to avail loan from the Banks/Financial Institutions: Handloom Weavers, Weaver Entrepreneurs, Self Help Groups, Joint Liability Groups, Handloom organizations, etc.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for individuals who have already availed Margin Money Assistance?
faqs.answer: Individual weaver who have already availed margin money assistance will not be eligible for financial assistance in terms of margin money assistance, interest subvention and credit guarantee fee.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for Fresh loan?
faqs.answer: Fresh loan may be sanctioned after one year of re-payment of previous mudra loan to the handloom beneficiaries.

faqs.question: How can apply for loan under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible beneficiaries are required to approach Participating Bank concerned along with required documents for availing loan benefits under the scheme.
